Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TheGGs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Manfredi for 4 nights in early March. The room was comfortable, very clean and nicely decorated, with a flat screen. The Via Margutta where the hotel is located is very quiet. There are art galleries and restaurants nearby. Breakfast was perfect with home-made cakes, fruits, delicious cappuccinos, etc. We were "lucky": the hotel was nearly empty due to off-peak season and the staff really made us feel welcome! Our only complaint is that we were told upon arrival that we would get an upgrade from a Deluxe King Room to an Executive King Room, but obviously it was still the Deluxe King (no bathrobe, slippers, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Dolce Vita, Italian Luxury,Very attentive staff. A great place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: DujardinP
Reviews.Content: My son (17 y.) and I stayed at Hotel Manfredi April 3 - 7, 2012. You are immediately greeted by a staff speaking perfect English or even other languages . After a great and warm smile, they take care of your luggage, give you proposals of the right places to visit Rome, for lunch... Great, you are at home! It's a very warm and friendly environment. The room is decorated in the "Italian baroque" style, clear and very clean. The bathroom is fabulous. Breakfast was amazing, absolutely delicious food every day. It's a great place to visit Rome, very good location. I've stayed several times in Rome and this hotel is now my preferred address in Rome and certainly for my friends.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kay Louis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Manfredi March 26 - 29, 2012. It's a very nice clean Italian hotel with a great staff. The staff were courteous and helpful. It's a very warm and friendly environment. The breakfast buffet was very nice as well. There was a variety of things to eat. We had a small room by American standards but we had enough room for 2 large bags and 2 backpacks. The staff will store your bags for you if you want more space. They also have larger rooms available. The hotel is on one floor of an old building. It's nicely decorated and our bathroom was very nice. It appears that the hotel has been newly updated. This location is only a few blocks from the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain and is on a quiet street. We absolutely loved it. We would stay here again and highly recommend it to anyone who wants to have a fun time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Roman experience”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkarchitect
Reviews.Content: We had an inner room. It was very quiet, but also dark. On the other hand, we got an upgrade which gave us a room with a very comfortable tub. The furnishings were very Italian, in a traditional way. Reproductions rather than antiques, and lots of prints and patterns.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: ffranks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Manfredi for four nights in February. The hotel was fabulous - perfect location, lovely rooms, great staff - couldn't fault it at all. We had a complimentary room upgrade which really made our stay all the more special. Breakfast was amazing, absolutely delicious food every day & lots of choice. Nothing was too much trouble & every member of staff was attentative & very helpful. It is located literally a 5 minute walk from the Spanish Steps so very central to everything...& just behind one of the main shopping streets! Free wifi was great. Loved it & we can't wait to come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend A Roma”
Reviews.Author: Mary H
Reviews.Content: Good hotel: on the fashionable artists' street, via Margutta - comfortable, clean and right in the middle of Rome - five minutes' walk from the Spanish Steps and, in the opposite direction, Piazza del Popolo and the magnificent belvedere, Il Pincio, where you can see most of Rome in one stunning panoramic glance! The rooms in the Manfredi are tastefully furnished - my bathroom had a Jacuzzi and romantic coloured lights. Breakfast was a buffet with fresh bread rolls and pastries, excellent mortadella and Parma ham, good cappuccino. Courteous, professional and efficient staff - excellent English. Highly reccomended. We went by car but left it in the nearby Villa Borghese carpark after taking our bags to the hotel - not far to walk but a taxi back to the hotel was less than €10. Give the hotel reception staff your registration number in order to avoid Limited Traffic Zone (ZTL) fines.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: newyorkersEngland
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth visit and we will be back! The staff at the Hotel Manfredi continue to be wonderful! Very friendly and helpful...if there is anything you need, just ask...it's never a problem. Breakfasts continue to be superb, and we finally met the woman who makes all those wonderful breakfast cakes. There is also homemade yoghurt, fresh fruit, bread rolls, croissants, meats and cheeses, scrambled eggs, and great espresso! What more could you ask for! We stayed in a Junior Suite this time, which had a walk-in closet...so there was plenty of storage for our 6 night stay. Spotlessly clean, of course, and fully serviced every with fresh towels and amenities. Can't wait to go back! See you soon Roberta! Great location too....close to all the tourist sites and lots of great restaurants closeby.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ilkim
Reviews.Content: Perfect address for visiting Rome. Via Margutta is a must-see anyway. The hotel staff was very helpful and extremely kind. We got a superior double room and even though it was extremely small it was enough for two days. We will be going back but book a larger room next time. The room was spotless clean. Breakfast was good but there is a lovely cafe right in front of Spanish Steps which is full of locals having morning coffees. It was next to the Christian Dior store. For dinner we strongly recommend Life on Via delle Vite which is a very short walk (not in high heels). When we came back to Rome after 3 days, Hotel Manfredi was full and we had to stay at Hotel Forte which was in the same building, one floor down. It was a very big mistake and a very unpleasant stay. Please see separate review for Hotel Forte.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Trevor C
Reviews.Content: I have travelled a lot and stayed in some top class hotels but this one ranks along the best in the world. Tucked away on a quiet street a short walk from the Spanish Steps it is without doubt the place to stay in Rome. We stayed over Christmas with 2 children and the staff were fantastic - thanks in particular to Nadia who my son fell in love with even though he is only 6 and also Santa who arrived with a present for the children. Also thanks to Roberta and all the other staff who made our stay memorable. The food was good and the small bar was stocked with a good selection of wines. The rooms were comfortable and the only minor criticism is that there are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Despite that, the hotel should be at the top of the list for anyone wanting a hotel that will not fail to please. We walked everywhere from the hotel (even the Vatican and the Colosseum) but there are numerous taxis just in front of the Spanish Steps. Nothing is too much trouble at the Manfredi - if you want a top class hotel with a family feel - dont go anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Manfredi = Perfection in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Susan A
Reviews.Content: Ah, what can I say about a place that welcomes you with such a warm embrace? The first thing Emanuele said when we checked in was "We want this to be your home". Well, I wish my home was as exquisitely decorated as Hotel Manfredi with just the right combination of classic elegance and modern amenities. I could not wish for a more wonderful, gracious, and professional staff. After one day they know you, what you like and how you like it and go out of their way to take care of you. I have been in Italy many times and enjoyed stays in hotels large and small; a fantastic location and beautiful rooms like these can be found in all of her cities. Hotel Manfredi gave us an additional gift.....a big warm hug.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and greal location”
Reviews.Author: Rogaj
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with the great location...Spanish steps 1min, Fontana Trevi 10min, Vatican 20min, Coloseum 20min, shopping area is around the hotel... Rooms are big enough, breakfast is great, staff is very helpful. Bathroom door are sliding and can not be shut properly so that can be a problem sometimes. Overall I would recommend this hotel, especially if you can get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time for us; still brilliant”
Reviews.Author: outpaddling
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Manfredi about a year ago and are overjoyed to return. This stay was for three nights in an executive double room. We are still impressed with the staff and the quality of the accomodations. There is not much more to add but just wanted people to know that The Manfredi is so good you will want to return time and time again.

Reviews.Title: “An unbelievable deal, great, great find!”
Reviews.Author: colin s
Reviews.Content: Great room, great extras (free wifi, breakfast, drinks at happy hour)- an easy must stay, no questions asked. Nothing I could find wrong with the hotel. I asked politely a really good restaurant to spend the night,Porto di Ripetta Restaurant truly impeccable, I must thank them, it was an unforgettable place

Reviews.Title: “Great choice near the Spanish Steps!”
Reviews.Author: Karen P
Reviews.Content: Hotel Manfredi is a boutique hotel, very close to the Spanish Steps, yet nestled away from the busyness! We stayed 3 nights and were very happy that we chose this hotel. Manfredi has excellent breakfasts, with freshly baked cakes & pastries daily and an amazing fruit salad! The staff were friendly, helpful and full of great suggestions. the rooms are very small (we chose the middle size) however they are well appointed and modern. We did have internet difficulties but the staff arranged for us to use their computer once per day. If you are energetic and active, you can use this hotel as a base and walk to all of the tourist areas.... Colisseum, Vatican, Trevi Fountain, etc. Be sure to plan ahead, most of these areas are best to go to first thing in the morning to avoid long line-ups. There are 3 or 4 different "Hop on-Hop off" bus companies - and we highly recommend doing that for a good tour of the areas, with information provided in your native language.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality at fair price”
Reviews.Author: Denmark46
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our 5 nights stay at Manfredi's. Reservation was made directly and last-minute, and everything including a swift airport pick-up was exactly as promised. After a quiet nights sleep in a luxurious bed (real king-size mattress, not two twins pushed together) we enjoyed the best breakfast to be had anywhere from freshly prepared ingredients. The staff was truly pleasant and helpful, and obviously enjoying having visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, super location”
Reviews.Author: Senior_Girl
Reviews.Content: After taking an early morning train from Venice to Rome, we proceeded directly to the Hotel Manifredi. Even though we arrived at the hotel ~2 hours before check-in time, the front staff welcomed us warmly, provided us a complimentary cold glass of white wine, and got our room readied for us. The room was well furnished, clean, and decorated very nice. I need a good, comfortable bed to sleep, and was not disappointed. Although the bathroom is on the small size, it was still very nicely appointed. The breakfast at the Hotel Manfredi was superb. Lots of hot and cold food, including eggs/bacon with an absolutely wonderful large selection of pastry. Hotel Manfredi is close to, but below, the Spanish Steps and only a few short blocks to the Metro train. Nice area, nice street, and very convenient. Our 2011 European vacation was 17 nights and 7 hotels. The Hotel Manfredi exceeded our expectations, and was the best hotel we stayed in during the 17 nights in Europe. No complaints, only compliments to the Hotel Manfredi, and it's staff. Thank you for making our Rome vacation a memorable one. Hope to see you again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: Dragonese
Reviews.Content: We had two interconnecting rooms at this hotel - both were beautifully decorated (one with a four poster bed) with an elegance and character which more than made up for the small size of the rooms. Lovely, polite and helpful staff. It is in a great location for walking through historic Rome, close to the Spanish steps. Rather pricey, but not bad value given general costs in Rome. Also provided a wonderful breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: RockymtnsAlberta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last week for five days. Perfect location - we walked everywhere! Front desk and breakfast staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was small but we were out all day. Nice touch is the small pocket size guide to Rome the hotel gives to guests. We used it every day for our outings. Only thing I missed was tea-making facilities!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth staying here again”
Reviews.Author: LondonDudeLondon
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Rome, and I was in charge of arranging my family's holiday there. I was quite nervous as to which hotel I would choose, as I had no expreience with any, nor did I know any locals. So, quite randomly I had decided on Hotel Manfredi. Firstly, don't let the hotel front put you off. The taxi had dropped us off in a tiny street, to what had appeared to be 'Hotel Forte.' After a minute's lookaround, I had realised that Hotel Manfredi was located in the same building, but on the 3rd floor (Hotel Forter, with the bigger sign, was on the 1st Floor). The entrance you probably see in photos is the hotel front, but on the 3rd floor. After such a surprise, I was quite nervous with what I had gotten myself into. So, into the charming European lift towards the 3rd floor, and now Hotel Manfredi is clearly marked. Immediately, the worker there was welcoming, and did not hesitate to try his English (by the way, it was perfectly good!). After check in, we were introduced into our various rooms. The rooms were small'ish, with minimal light, but to very good spec, particularly the clean albeit tight washrooms. Mind you, this is a very old city, and at a hotel that doesn't cost you an arm and a leg. The room was charming (not a euphemism), the Wifi was consistent, and the hotel as a whole was very quite. I couldn't have been more pleased. Given that Italians don't really do breakfast (a la English/American 'meals'), it was great that the hotel offered such food. Though I was more than willing to adapt to the continental lifestyle, my elderly parents couldn't be blamed for wanting the breakfasts they're used to. In terms of the location, it was fantastic. Literally a stone's throw from the Spanish Steps, and a handful of high-label design shops (Gucci, Prada, Bulgari, etc), with about a 5 minute walk to more casual shopping. Rome itself isn't all too big, and this hotel is situated at about the top-middle of the touristic activity. For our longer outings, a taxi queue was literally 3 minutes away (facing the Spanish Steps). I'd have zero hesitation in returning to this hotel should I find myself in Rome again. I'd say for business, perhaps not the most suitable, but for personal holiday and romantic getaways, this is a deal to be had!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel with fantastic location - 3 star but feels like 4 star”
Reviews.Author: JoshS_London
Reviews.Content: We were really pleasantly surprised by Hotel Manfredi. After struggling to find it (it is above Hotel Forte - the sign isn't too clear) and having to go separately up the elevator which only holds 1 person with bags, we found ourselves in a lovely reception area kindly greeted by Emanuele who was very friendly throughout our stay. Brilliant location just a few minutes from Spanish Steps and safe, trendy area with designer shops. Great breakfast with fresh pastries and good fruit selection (decent for veggies like us). Nicely decorated rooms and very clean - you could see it has been recently renovated. The only draw back is that the rooms are very small, but once you get used to this it is fine. Other positives: - Very helpful service when booking trains. - Quick internet.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms but everything else was Great!”
Reviews.Author: Calyan
Reviews.Content: After arriving at Ciampino airport we were taken by arranged car (not with the hotel) to the Hotel Manfredi. It wasn't very clear where the hotel was but we found it with little trouble. After walking up the stairs due too the elevator only taking one person with bags, we arrived at the reception desk and the staff there were very helpful and we were immediately shown to our rooms. The rooms, while extremely small were very nicely appointed with nice bathrooms and enough space to leave your bags and unpack. While you could only have breakfast at the hotel, because of the very convenient location, right by piazza d'espagna and all the upmarket shops, we were able to find many nice restaurants in the surrounding area. At night, it was quite noisy and you were forced to end up waking up early due to the scooters buzzing by. However breakfast was very nice with any type of thing you could want. Due to the very near transport links and upmarket shops you could do anything from your hotel. A taxi rank and a metro stop were 5 minutes away from the hotel. This hotel was much better than expected and we could definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Four Start Service in a Three Star hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeltaDawnD2
Reviews.Content: Hotel Manfredi changed my thinking about Rome. The hotel was beautiful, immaculate, and very well run. The room was quiet and comfortable. The location is fantastic. The breakfast was excellent. And the staff could not be more helpful. We especially appreciated the restaurant suggestions from Roberto, as well as the private tour he arranged for us of the Forum and Coliseum - absolutely worth the cost!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: astorti
Reviews.Content: I had the good fortune to stay at Hotel Manfredi for my first trip to Rome. We stayed for 3 days and couldn't have been happier with the accomodations, location and the excellent service that we received. The staff was wonderful. And don't even get me started on the free breakfast... fantastic! I know that when I go back to Rome, I'll be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and convenient location...”
Reviews.Author: trang2010
Reviews.Content: I had a little issue with Hotel Manfredi last year in 2010. I had booked a room for my daughter and I to stay at the hotel for 3 nights in October. Rome was our first stop in Italy directly from the US. Three days prior to our departure to Italy , my father-in-law passed away. I had to cancel 4 hotels of the trip. Every hotel graciously gave us full refund although we violated the cancellation rule. Hotel Manfredi was the only hotel which did not respond ! I wrote many emails to both Hotel Manfredi and the agency which I made the reservation through. There was absolutely no response! Finally I had to call Italy from California (at 5:00am California time). After several calls over a period of a month, I finally had the word from the owner and the owner's son (Mr Francesco) to keep my reservation open for future stay. But no refund could be made ! I was very disappointed of the poor service and the lack of response. We returned to Italy in June 2011, stayed at Hotel Manfredi but had to pay extra due to higher rate in June. Hotel Manfred is very nice on the 3rd floor of a building. To go up to the 3rd floor, we could take the elevator or walk the stairs. The room is small but very comfortable, The bathroom is tiny but ultra modern and sparkling clean. The shower is extravagently nice with ligths that turn colors like in a disco. Breakfast was very good and the service is extremely outstanding. The best thing is the location. Hotel Manfredi is on Margutta street which is a cobblestoned and most charming street with houses' facade covered with ivy . Margutta is parallel to a main street and yet it is very quiet. Hotel Manfredi is just a couple short blocks away from the Spanish Steps. There are a lot of small cute shops in the area and many nice little restaurants just a block away, also in cute cobblestoned streets. Comparing to more popular tourist areas like Fiore de Campi or Piazza Navona, the Spanish Steps area is so much better as it is more quiet and yet very close to everywhere else, even by foot. Hotel Manfredi is a very nice place to stay. I highly recommend it ..... if you do not get into a cancellation situation !

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: TKe7
Reviews.Content: Rooms are not big, the ventilation is poor, the AC is noicy, there is no curtain in the tub, the rooms are quiet, unless the reception is speaking on the phone but... Considering the location, the nice interior and breakfast, we were glad to make this choice. The problems I listed are hard to avoid in big cities. It's not a brethtaking experience, but it works if your main agenda is to see the city, not the hotel. 662 EUR/ 2 people in std.superior room for four nights in February is okay price for the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: newyorkersEngland
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Hotel Manfredi, and we stayed 7 nights this time. The service was absolutely superb---the staff is very friendly, helpful, and seem to enjoy when you practice your Italian on them. They'll also give you directions, get you a car to the airport (use their private car instead of a taxi---it's only Euro 5 more, and a more pleasant ride in a nicer car!) Room was spotlessly clean and fully serviced every day. Breakfast was even better than our last visit---in addition to the large breakfast buffet, they've added wonderful homemade yoghurt as well as homemade little cakes! Location is great too--on the famous Via Margutta, and close to everything. There was nothing else we could have needed--if there was, the Manfredi staff would have sorted it out for us! You couldn't pick a better place to stay when exploring Rome..

Reviews.Title: “good choice of hotel”
Reviews.Author: Razigirl
Reviews.Content: superb location. loads of great restaurants close by. main attractions are close by and the furtherest are 30 mins by foot . hotel itself had very helpful and friendly staff. great breakfast and the rooms were small however decorated lovely and kept clean. highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the best of all the hotels we had in Italy”
Reviews.Author: jenstau
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Florence, Venice and our last stop was in Rome and this hotel was definitely the best one we stayed in out of all the stops we made. The room, while small, was very nice and clean. I would much rather have a nice, clean room than a large one that is shabby. The service was excellent! I don't remember his name, but the man at the front desk when we checked in gave us a map and marked every single spot we wanted to see and told us how far a walk it was...we especially liked his tips on where to shop! The breakfast was wonderful as well! Overall, this hotel had everything we were looking for: location, friendly staff, clean and updated rooms, and a great breakfast. Wonderful place to stay in Rome, and we hope to be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value.”
Reviews.Author: HDR71
Reviews.Content: The hotel has very recently been renovated, so the rooms and furnishing are in excellent condition and extremely functional. The location on via Margutta could not be better. The service was very good and helpful, although they did forget our wakeup call the second morning, and we almost missed our appointment as a result. Overall, this hotel provides excellent value in a city of very expensive hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ranaya12
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a side street off the Spanish Steps. It's on the third floor, which is a bit odd, but not a problem for us. The service provided is amazing! Emanuelle was gracious and welcoming everytime we encountered him. The hotel is centrally located to all the major cites in Rome. We walked everywere! The longest walk was probably to the Vatican (about 30 minutes) but everything else was a few minutes away. If you dont want to walk, the train station is right by the Spanish Steps and about a 1 minute walk from the hotel. My only complaint would be the beds being too hard. However, we found this to be the case in all hotels in Italy. Also, for those who are not aware (I wasn't) irons are not allowed in any hotels in Italy. Be prepared to walk around with wrinkled clothes unless you brink your own travelling iron.

Reviews.Title: “Manfredi”
Reviews.Author: ChrisRocha
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is on the 3rd floor of a building, no lobby and you just have to ring the bell so they can buzz you in. No security. The room is clean and well decorated, but the shower is veryvery small with a poor draining system, flooding the floor each time we had a shower ! Very good breakfast. The hotel is near Piazza di Spagna and walking distance to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “10 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: JUDI07_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near the Spanish steps and in a great location central to most sightseeing places. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful with recommendations of places to eat and assistance when we missed a tour we had pre-booked and got the date mixed up. The room was very comfortable and quiet - great bath. Plenty of choice at the buffet breakfast and pleasant atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant solution to where to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: outpaddling
Reviews.Content: Thank you to all the travelers who have reviewed this property and made our selection so easy. My wife and I have finally found the ideal hotel in Rome and have no need to ever stay anywhere else. The hotel exceeded all our expectations. Plus, there is no better location in Rome for dining, shopping and walking. We plan to return soon. One thing you should know, however: There is no traditional lobby and you must take an old gated elevator to register. Later, we discovered this was actually a bonus since no areas are open to the public and we felt like VIPs with the extra security.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing time warp of history, culture, romance, great cuisine, and more”
Reviews.Author: TheCamilleris
Reviews.Content: It was an amazing weeked!!! The rooms were exactly as described on the internet, to the least minimun detail. It was perfectly located in the most sought-after area of Piazza di Spagna, and yet, tucked away from all the noise. Not to mention the fact that we had the metro-underground just around the corner - which is saying a lot in Rome! We were greeted by the very friendly staff on our arrival, and even on our depature, since we had an early flight, we had to wake up very early. Even though we could not have breakfast, the staff called a taxi for us and made us tea and coffee while waiting. The room was fantastic, beautifully decorated in matching satin burgundy-coloured wall-paper and cutains, just like in the picture! The breafast was very good and abundant!!! Great buffet! Even thought the hotel was not one of the cheapest, we certainly got our value for money, because it was amazingly clean, comfortable and fitted the picture perfectly! I would recommend this hotel, and if in Rome, I would definately go back to stay there, without hesitation! Grazie a tutti voi, a Hotel Manfredi !!

Reviews.Title: “What more could you want?”
Reviews.Author: TataPaloAlto
Reviews.Content: Location, clean, friendly, comfortable, wireless, great bathrooms and comfy beds! We've been to Rome many times to visit family and this hotel beats them all! It's like staying at a 5 star hotel but hosted by a warm and caring staff. This hotel is owned by a family and run by the family.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: jacqcampbell
Reviews.Content: It wasn't the cheapest hotel, but it was worth every penny (Euro, really)! Location was ideal - right by the Spanish Steps yet is not in the middle of the throngs of people. Staff was all very friendly and helpful too. It would have been a perfect 10 if soundproofing was a notch up, but it really forgivable, in view of everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KeenYolcu
Reviews.Content: Hotel Manfredi was a great little hotel in my new favorite city, Rome! My husband and I traveled along with another couple to Rome at the end of November. We spent five very comfortable nights at Hotel Manfredi and will definitely return when in Rome again. The location is absolutely perfect; on a lovely little side street just minutes away from The Spanish Steps and the best shopping street in Rome. Fashion savvy individuals might be interested to know that Manfredi is located directly across from Miu Miu. We opted for a superior room and found it perfectly suited for us. The decor is quite classic, but it is obvious that it was done very recently. The rooms were very, very clean and nothing appeared old or out of date. There were plenty of extra pillows, blankets and towels. Although not incredibly spacious, the size of the room was just fine and above average compared to rooms I've seen in Paris, Florence, etc. The breakfast buffet was super- fresh fruit, cold cuts, cheeses, jams, boiled eggs, pastries, homemade yogurt, cereals, etc. Moreover, the dining staff was extra nice to our group as they always happily served us even though we constantly showed up for breakfast just minutes before it was about to finish, and even a morning or two showing up several minutes after the posted hours. In all, Manfredi was the perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent celebration in Rome”
Reviews.Author: HerrSvensson
Reviews.Content: My wife and me went to Rome, together with eleven friends, to celebrate a birthday. I had looked at different hotels through Internet (no hotel booking sites) and found hotel Manfredi to suite our needs. The presentation looked good but you can’t be sure that in reality everything is at it says. We booked the Margutta suite one superior room and the rest classic standard doubles. I asked the hotel to do some preparation (flowers, welcome cards, welcome reception with snacks, sandwiches and so on). I must say that the hotel looked as nice as in the description on Internet. Or even nicer! The location is on a quiet street close to the Spanish Steps. We walked from the hotel to the main attractions as Fontana di Trevi, Panteon, Colosseum, The Vatican, Campo di Fiori, and Piazza Navona. And the shopping streets were just outside the hotel. The staff were very helpful, the service superb and everything was according to my wishes. Breakfast was very good, with fresh fruit and my wife specially loved their homemade yogurt. The Suite Margutta was fantastic; we loved every moment there. The classic standard doubles was small (what the heck, the similar rooms in New York are also small). All rooms were very well kept, perfect to the smallest details with superb design. We thought we stayed in a five star hotel. We stayed five nights in January 2010 and it was quite cold outside at night, but all the rooms had excellent heating. Hotel Manfredi occupies second and third floor of an old building with an charming old elevator. We all loved every minute of our stay. All of us warmly recommend Hotel Manfredi!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastique”
Reviews.Author: BrusselsLucy
Reviews.Content: Excellent situation. Almost noise free. Breakfast buffet excellent. Courteous staff. Clean rooms. A real find in Rome. (We researched for two weeks!)

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful find”
Reviews.Author: PeterandHeidi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Manfredi in late October for five days and thoroughly enjoyed our experience. The location is perfect--close to many attractions, restaurants, the Metro but so very quiet. The staff is excellent, friendly and very, very helpful. The rooms are small but beautifully decorated and the breakfast well prepared and a very pleasant way to start the day. The only downside we experienced was the noise of slamming doors in the breakfast area--an issue which should be easily fixed. Picking the Manfredi was an excellent decision and a great way to start a vacation. No question that when back in Rome, we' stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Magical!! Staff is fantastic and location is perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: classics3302
Reviews.Content: Located on beautiful via margutta, this place is fantastic!! Can't say enough about the staff (say hi to Daniella for us!). Extremely helpful with tips on where to go to shop (that wouldn't break the bank!!) and the touristy stuff too. Location can't be beat, close to the Spanish Steps and walking distance to buses and taxi stands that will get you all over the city. Can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and very Italian”
Reviews.Author: adelenicola
Reviews.Content: Great hotel located close to the 7 steps. decor is flamboyant everything is red and gold, rooms are small but this is normal in Rome as space is at a premium. Satyed here several times for business, service is excellent and can recommend so great places. The hotel is small with few facilities but is cosy, charming and has excellent service. It is very expensive in peak season-september period and can get better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING LOCATION AND FRIENDLY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: loverofmilan
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night (on business) at the Hotel Manfredi - 24th September 09. I was pleasantly surprised by the helpful and friendly staff - this is not always the case in hotels I use in Italy. The room was clean, quiet and modern, with everything at your fingertips. However, it was small. I had a double for single use which was perfect for one night, but I think I would have battled in the tiny bathroom for a longer period. I had just arrived after staying in a 4* hotel in Florence and this hotel, rated as 3* was far superior. The breakfast was excellent and the staff friendly and accommodating. For a South African, it was not cheap, but the location was fantastic. I walked out the door and within minutes was at the Spanish Steps and the main shopping streets. I understood from a staff member the hotel was really a 4*, but due to not having a restaurant, they were rated as 3*. There are also extra taxes involved the higher the rating of the hotel. I would definitely stay again, but would try to do it in a lower season, as my rate for one person was high.

Reviews.Title: “You need to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: kitnsaly
Reviews.Content: I travel agent who lives in Florence booked this hotel for me, and I couldn't have asked for anything better! After visiting 7 different cities in Italy, this hotel had the best breakfast. The location was perfect and within walking distance to so many popular attractions, Spanish steps, shopping, Trevi Fountain, bus stop for the Hop on Hop Off Bus. The desk staff always tried to help me figure out where I was going. The room itself was what I expected for a large European city. I don't need a lot of room, but I do ask for a clean room, and that's what I got! Although, the entrance is different, it's not bad! The price could have been cheaper, but I will not complain based on all the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; a little pricey though”
Reviews.Author: flatbstanley
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in this hotel in late May. The service was very good; the staff was fluent in English and was helpful with the questions we had. The room was comfortable with good bedding, a little small, but no worse than one normally sees in Europe. It is very close to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain, on a quiet, charming street packed with art galleries. If you're into ruins you'll have a long hike or a subway ride, though, so those looking to see Roman sights might want to look elsewhere. While we enjoyed the Hotel Manfredi, I don't think the rooms and the service quite justify the hefty price. We ended up staying here because it was the only hotel where we could get reservations, and though it's nice, if we return to Rome we will look for something less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Will coma back again”
Reviews.Author: Swedesnear50
Reviews.Content: good location near quiet nice road. Very clean nice room, but small (but that was said so it was no surprice, you can choose bigger ones) nice and helpful staff. best breakfast i ever had in hotel in Europe We are very satisfied, couldn´t be better

Reviews.Title: “First stay , would definitely come back.”
Reviews.Author: leftymn
Reviews.Content: The Manfredi is the type of place I normally would not tell people about, like a good fishing hole. The hotel is very nicely maintained, the staff was friendly and polite. The breakfast buffet of fresh baked croisants and pastries, home made yogurt and meats, cheeses, cereals and fresh fruit was one of the best I have had in Italy. The breakfast staff were cheerful and inviting. The rooms are small as is the bathroom, but the appointments are excellent. If you need alot of space this probably wont work for you, but you are in Rome and alot of space will cost you! The hotel is on the 3rd floor and has an antique elevator, but that is part of the charm of the place. The Via Margutta is a quiet artistic street and the location is excellent for exploring Rome by foot, or you can be on the Metro at the Spagna in 5 minutes. No free wifi, but I believe they had free wired high speed in room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, service, location”
Reviews.Author: VisitRome7
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Hotel Manfredi after staying there for 3 nights (Aug 21 to 24th). The hotel room is magnificent (very high class). The room/bathroom were above and beyond what we expected. The service from all the staff was excellent as well. They were all very friendly and helpful. It made us feel very well cared for. Rome being a walking city we couldn't wait to get back to the peace and tranquility of the hotel at the end of each day. The lady who took care of our room did a very fine job, it was like the day we first arrived -- immaculately clean all throughout. The bed was very comfortable and each night's sleep was very quiet. We did not however try their breakfast although it was offered to us everyday because we were always on the go. The other strong points are the location, we were only minutes away from the restaurants as well as the sites such as Piazza Spagna; shopping district, the Fontana de Trevi, and the Supermarket. At night around 9pm we would walk to the Piazza Spagna to hang around and it felt very safe. Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel. I am glad I chose this hotel among the other that I had researched over the Internet/Bookstores. I would most definitely stay there on my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: busygirlla
Reviews.Content: You feel like you're in Old Rome with the elevator in this hotel and the rooms and bathrooms. It is a beautiful boutique hotel. They don't have a restaurant but they offer free breakfast, which is okay - it's croissants, pastries, fruit and yogurt, if you're into that. If you like heavier breakfast, you would have to go out and find a restaurant which was not hard at all. There is a grocery store very close to this hotel which is great when you need essentials like water, etc, so this will help you cut down on a few expenses. The location is great, although it took me a couple days to figure out the streets because it was like a maze. I would defiinitely stay here again if I come to Rome. Although, I am surprised with the price, because Summer 2007 this hotel was about $250-$300 only, and it's gone up quite a bit. If the price is around $500+ I wouldn't recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bowman23
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at Hotel Manfredi for a week, and it was a wonderful experience. The hotel is very clean, the employees are very kind and helpful, and the location is great. A great bargain! Claudia M Texas

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Manfredi Rome is a Very over priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: noomi
Reviews.Content: This is our 31st time in Italy. This hotel has very Tiny rooms up keep is so, so. Breakfast area is to small to accommodate one half of a normal capacity. Food selection for breakfast is very poor. Staff is very nice. Overall rating: un justify over priced hotel. For the money you spent you can do a lot better,

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Manfredi”
Reviews.Author: TexasMusicmom
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenage son and I stayed at the Manfredi last month for a total of 8 days and we would definitely stay there again. Roberta was very efficient, helpful (and patient!) on the many e-mails sent, as well as during our stay, as was Sandrine and other staff (didn't get everyone's name). Iwona (in the breakfast room) makes a delicious cappuccino and was always gracious. The breakfast offering was bountiful: eggs, meat, cheese, cereal, croissants and other pastries, yoghurt, fruit, juice, etc. The staff recommendations for restaurants were terrific. The location was super. Our room was very quiet (and I'm a fairly light sleeper). The hotel is small, intimate (feels like you're stepping into a private townhouse), and had a very safe feeling. We were told they would be expanding to the floor below. We will stay at the Manfredi on our next trip to Roma (if they're not closed for renovations). Mille Grazie to the Manfredi, from the Owens Family

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Family of 4”
Reviews.Author: DrTaras
Reviews.Content: 1) Extremely responsive to your e-mails & they speak English. Also, there is a 5% discount for booking directly through their web site. 2) They can arrange transportation for you that is moderately priced. You may be able to find it for slightly less, independently. They can also arrange for tours. The front desk was extremely friendly and helpful. 3) Location, location, location! You can not stay any closer to the Spanish Steps, yet it be very secluded at night for sleep. The hotel occupies the 3rd floor of a building, but you do not hear any street noise, nor any noise from the upstairs or outside your door. I think that the Spanish Steps is the best place to stay while in Rome. It feels the safest & cleanest, yet so centrally located. 4) This is a 3 star hotel, so do not expect 4 star amenities! While it is charming & quaint, like a European Bed & Breakfast should be, it is far from grandeur and splendor which Americans are used to in a resort hotel. Since I mentioned breakfast, I will say that it was lovely & a full breakfast, not just Coffee & Danish. 5) Our rooms air-conditioning unit felt underpowered. It was not oppressive, but for the 2 nights that we stayed there, it was tolerable. It was our fault for not reporting it, though I do not know what they could have done about it? 6) We had the 4 person room. The size of the room is what a normal American hotel room would be with a King-Sized bed & a little niche for a seating area. Instead the niche has 2 cot-like (comfortable) beds so the room gets cramped. The bathroom has a small 4 steps up to it which can pose some logistic difficulties, but is fine. This is a great compromise alternative for families with 2 young children (under 12 would be my guess) & don't want to utilize an adjoining room scenario for cost containment. There are not many hotels in Rome who offer this. 7) For a short stay, under 3 night, I'd stay there again. For longer I feel it would get to cramped & maybe opt for the same hotel, but 2 rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eagles5
Reviews.Content: Our family of five recently stayed for three nights at the Hotel Manfredi and it was exactly what we had hoped for. Located on Via Margutta, a small, quiet street near the Spanish Steps and the designer shops, it proved be a convenient starting point for all of our excursions. Both of our rooms were well decorated with fabric wall coverings and comfortable beds. The marble baths were small but very clean. The individual room AC controls were great, especially during the week we were there in July. The best part about our stay, however, was the friendly staff that helped us with reservations and answered all our questions. They were clearly the best staff we met during our two weeks in Italy. The morning breakfast included pastry, fruit, cereal and yogurt, as well as great cappuccino. The hotel is located on the fourth floor and a unique elevator from the lobby is provided. When we returned to Rome the night before our flight home, we stayed at another small hotel in the same area, but it did not compare to the Hotel Manfredi. We would definitely stay there again. (In the movie "Roman Holiday"-Gregory Peck tells the cabbie that he lives on Via Margutta).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emerson7
Reviews.Content: Six of us from New England stayed in 3 rooms for 3 nights and all of us enjoyed our stay. The front desk was friendly and very helpful with restaurant choices and transportation. I think it's the best buy for that area of Rome. We liked the breakfasts and the very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on a great street”
Reviews.Author: trip303
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome in early May 2007 and stayed at the Manfredi for 2 nights. It is a very nice little hotel on the 4th floor of the building. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room clean. Breakfast was great and the cappuccino a treat that got us hooked. The neighborhood is great, close to the Spanish Steps and other great sights. Via Margutta, the street the hotel is located on, is a wonderful street with interesting shops and nice restaurants, We always enjoyed the walk to and from the hotel . We would reccomend the Manfredi and would stay again. We had an excellent experience here to start our Italian adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel... right by the Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: boston76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Manfredi for 6 nights and would definitely recommend this hidden gem on a side street off of the Piazza di Spagna. We had a superior room that was large enough by American standards. It was nicely decorated and the pictures on the hotel's website accurately reflected the decor and size of the room. The bathroom was only okay. After reading the reviews of this hotel and many other Roman hotels in the area we were expecting very small accommodations. Our room was a pleasant surprise. The breakfast room was great and fueled us for our day's activites. We cannot say enough about the hotel staff. From dinner suggestions to shopping to walking directions, each staff member spoke good English and went above and beyond to help us on a daily basis with any question or request. Magdalena, Sandrine and Roberta were always cheerful, upbeat and greeted us with big welcoming smiles every time we returned to the hotel after a long day of sightseeing. We could walk to every sight in Rome! The hotel is only a 10-15 minutes walk to any sight in Rome with the Colosseum being about a 25 minute walk away. Would definitely stay here again and certainly recommend it to anyone looking for a moderate priced hotel in Rome by the Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a positive view of the Manfredi”
Reviews.Author: ZenP
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little hotel. Traditional and very clean and good value for money given its great position near the Spanish Steps and Rome's fancy shops. With limited facilities, it's a great place for someone that doesn't want to revolve his/her stay around the hotel.. But then, why would you in Rome !?... For the hungry amongst you, the advertised American Breakfast in the confirmation is really what Brits would describe as a Continental Buffet Breakfast .... croissants, pain chocolat, cheese, parma ham, yoghurts, fruit etc ..... nothing hot, but still good.... and great coffee. They have one table for two on the courtyard balcony... a nice spot.... look out for it. The other reviews have generally got it spot on and we enjoyed our stay. On check-in, they noticed from my passport that it was my birthday and delivered to our room a half bottle of wine, some chocolates and a card... a nice touch I felt. An issue regarding room availability on check-in was, after some discussion, settled to my complete satisfaction. Excellent reception staff... multi -lingual, well informed and as good as any top hotel in Europe. My wife and I would stay there again.... Zen Pawski, London, UK

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: YellowArrow
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent a night here recently and loved the experience! The hotel is located on a quiet street very near the Spanish Steps, shopping and restaurants.The hotel is actually on the third floor of the building so can be slightly confusing to find initially. There is a very small elevator. Our room was small but clean, nicely decorated, and comfortable although there was one small window without much view. Our three children were in the Junior Suite which was very roomy and beautifully decorated. They had a much larger window. The reception staff was very pleasant and helpful. There was a nice breakfast in a small breakfast room. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: halloween56
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and 2 teenage daughters spent 3 nights here in August. We weren't expecting too much as we had booked it more for convenience to central Rome and preferred the budget price, but we were quite happy that the hotel was clean and the service was very friendly. The all-inclusive breakfast was good and overall the hotel caters well for the visitor who is likely to spend most of their time walking around Rome rather than wanting to spend any time in their room. For the 4 of us the room was quite cramped and it was very difficult to get a view of the size when we booked it, but for the price it was good value and only 100 meters away from the Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “Such a friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Derbe
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic boutique hotel. The staff where excellent, friendly and attentive, nothing was to much trouble, even if arriving at 1.30am! The Hotel is clean, comfortable and very welcoming. The light but varied breakfast buffet was set out lovely and just enough for a full-days sight seeing. The coffee was very tasty, and an excellent choice of teas. The room and bathroom was a little small for 4, but well appointed with mini-bar etc. Couldn't of asked for a better location, handy for the Spanish-steps and Fountain de Trevi. Good choice of restaurants close by, and in the heart of the shopping centre Rome can be a busy and noisey city, but you would't of noticed this from the hotel. A very quiet spot. Do not be put off by the lower entrance, the basement has very little resemblance to a hotel lobby. You need to take the lift or steps to the 3rd floor, passing the hotel forte as you climb. Once in the hotels entrance, a warm welcome awaits you. I would stay here again, location fantastic and good for family rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Quads”
Reviews.Author: LatteGuzzler
Reviews.Content: Especially in view of the prior complaint referring to mold, I am pleased to praise the Manfredi in every respect. My wife and 2 sons and I had a glorious 3 night stay in a quadruple room at this charming boutique hotel at the end of June. The room was clean, comfortable and free of any moldy smells. The staff members were helpful and welcoming and the breakfast (included with our room) was a wonderful treat. The location - on the third floor of a building on a lovely, narrow one way street near the Spanish Steps and Via Condotti - was ideal as our base. We would gladly stay at the Manfredi again and strongly urge all who visit the area to consider staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great locale and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: NJItalianAngel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a wonderful surprise and in a great location. The rooms were tastefully decorated, bathrooms a bit small but workable and the beds comfortable. Two days before we were to arrive another friend decided to join us and the hotel was very accomodating and put a cot in the room for us. Breakfast was a treat with many things to choose from and the staff was happy to make espresso and cappuchino along with american coffee. It was on a small side street and not noisy at all. Would stay here again next time I visit Rome

Reviews.Title: “great for quads”
Reviews.Author: texas spot
Reviews.Content: I agree with the rest of the reviews. I would give the hotel an above average if it were not for the persistent moldy aroma. This was the case in two of our rooms. It did not bother me excessively (and I am very allergic) but the deordorizers used to disguise the aroma in our second room greatly bothered some of my companions. On the positive side, both rooms were quads which are VERY difficult to find in Europe, let alone Rome. The staff was extremely helpful, as was the doorman for the entire building on the ground floor. Similarly, the location is excellent and Via Margutta is a great spot. (Rent Roman Holiday for a cameo mention of Via Margutta.) The breakfast room is extremely small, but the choice was adequate. In addition, there was a superb selection of German/Austrian teas. I also suggest "Il Brillo Parlante" for a great lunch or dinner nearby. It is slightly Northwest of the hotel on a street that runs perpendicular to Via Margutta. Overall, if you need a quad, this is likely the best choice in the center of Rome, despite the moldy aroma.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite moderately priced hotel in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: shellm
Reviews.Content: 4 of us just spent 4 nights here and we did not want to leave. The rooms were kept very clean and they are nicely furnished. Compared to other hotels I have stayed in the superior rooms were a good size, as were the bathrooms. The breakfast is fine. The desk staff very nice and helpful. A great 3 star hotel...This is definately where I will stay when I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little spot”
Reviews.Author: DrDaithi
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel not knowing what to expect bar what we had read on this site...but we were very pleasantly surprised. We had booked a double superior room. The hotel is located on via Margutta which is a really quiet cobbled street just two minutes from the Spanish Steps, right across the street is a Prada shop which tells you something of the area. The Hotel itself is on the third floor of a lovely old building, the rooms are small, this is true but they are air conditioned (at least our one was but do check) and are furnished very nicely. There are adequate sized bathrooms ensuite with a fine size shower cubicle. The one thing I always look for in any hotel is the standard of cleanliness when you return to a room after being away for a day. I can only say that we were never disappointed, all the towels were changed, you could eat your dinner off the floor in the bathroom and the room was always left in perfect state. The breakfast room is small but lovely and the food is typical continental, you're not going to last the day on breakfast but when in rome etc ...! The staff are very helpful and will point to you to good places to eat and visit. The location is fantastic with the Steps, Vatican, Trevi Fountain and Pantheon all within 10-15 mins walking distance at a leisurely pace. All in all recommended for somewhere simple but clean and close to the centre. ps..we gor the express from Rome Fiumincino airport and the hotel is a 10 Euro approx taxi ride from the train station

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great location”
Reviews.Author: birmoz
Reviews.Content: I was really very impressed by this hotel. The rooms were rather small, but functional, the staff were by Roman standards great, breakfast was nice. The location is possibly the best in Rome.Overall the this place was almost faultless.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Clean, Courteous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with our two sons and their wives, stayed at the Manfredi for four nights in April, 2005. I corresponded with them by e-mail for a month before our arrival and relied on them for museum reservations and restaurant reccomendations, which were all excellent. They were helpful and pleasant in all that I requested. We had the three largest doubles and, while not commodious, they were certainly adequate and clean. The location is excellent, surrounded by antique and art shops and there was an art fair in the street, which is really more of an alley. It is only a few blocks to the Spanish Steps. My wife and I will return the next time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “good location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very close to piazza di spagna, our room was small but very clean like the entire hotel. Breakfast... go to the nearest bar! Staff was friendly. Overall nice but very expensive in high season.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: wlnyc
Reviews.Content: The location for the Hotel Manfredi is excellent, you can't ask for much better in Rome. The rooms are small, but liveable, though it gets a little hard to move around with two pieces of luggage (one of which ended up on the nightstand). A note to light sleepers: the walls here are really thin, and if you're next to a loud room you will be miserable. The bathrooms are a bit of a disappointment, the towels are thin and hard and one was dirty. The room itself was clean and the breakfast was good. The street is quiet and very cool, just steps from major attractions. Overall a good base to explore the city, but your expectations will not be surpassed.

Reviews.Title: “Haven in Roma”
Reviews.Author: AMSpalding
Reviews.Content: I had spent a lot of time researching for a hotel that was centrally located, in the mid-price range that was also quiet and we could not have been more pleased with our choice. Hotel Manfredi provided a relaxing haven at the end of a day's full-on sightseeing - set back from the bustle of the crowds in a street occupied by commercial art galleries and antique shops. As a newcomer to Rome, I knew it was just next to the Spanish Steps but to find it also in the heart of the designer shopping district (just behind the Prada shop in fact!) was an added bonus. Reception staff were utterly charming, especially Sendrine - breakfast staff less so. We booked a 'standard' double which we felt was worth it as the 'French' doubles looked a bit pinched and most did not seem to face out onto the street. Standard of cleanliness could not have been better - lovely marble bathroom and loads of toileteries replenished every day etc. This is a small hotel with a rather unassuming exterior (based on the third floor of an historic building, accessed by a lift) but don't let that put you off. Overall, the Manfredi would be a hard act to follow.

Reviews.Title: “lovely location, but small room!”
Reviews.Author: SCS
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Manfredi at the beginning of September 04 after our original hotel (Hotel Forte) was double booked. The hotel was above average in terms of location -it's very close to the metro and all the major tourist sites are within walking distance - and the staff were friendly and very helpful. Location was quiet too. The downside was that room was very small - we had a double - but there was literally no room to move. I did see that other doubles were larger so avoid room 111 if you can (unfortunately this was the only remaining room available when we arrived). On the whole a better than average 3 star but a week in room 111 would be very claustrophobic.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Manfredi Suite in Rome
HotelInfo.Address: Margutta, 61 | SPANISH STEPS, 00187 Rome, Italy
